cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 171 (Tuesday, November 19, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. SMITH of Washington:H.R. 10171.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1 Section 8The single subject of this legislation is:Prefabricated construction for affordable housing.[Page H6110]

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Financial Services, and in addition to the Committees on Ways and Means, and Science, Space, and Technology, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.title: To encourage local government reform of zoning and permitting to enhance housing affordability and economic growth, and for other purposes.

item.titleType: Short Title(s) as Introduced for portions of this bill
item.title: Prefabricated Housing and Zoning Enhancement Act of 2024
To encourage local government reform of zoning and permitting to enhance housing affordability and economic growth, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
